greekText: Μῆνιν ἄειδε θεὰ Πηληϊάδεω Ἀχιλῆος οὐλομένην
englishText: Sing, Muse, of the destructive wrath of Peleus’ son, Achilles
label: Iliad clause 1

englishText: which gave ten thousand pains to the Achaeans
label: Iliad clause 2

greekText: πολλὰς δ᾽ ἰφθίμους ψυχὰς Ἄϊδι προΐαψεν ἡρώων
englishText: and threw many strong souls of heroes to Hades
label: Iliad clause 3

greekText: αὐτοὺς δὲ ἑλώρια τεῦχε κύνεσσιν οἰωνοῖσί τε πᾶσι
englishText: and made them feasts for dogs and all birds
label: Iliad clause 4

englishText: and the will of Zeus was fulfilled
label: Iliad clause 5

greekText: ἐξ οὗ δὴ τὰ πρῶτα διαστήτην ἐρίσαντε Ἀτρεΐδης τε ἄναξ ἀνδρῶν καὶ δῖος Ἀχιλλεύς.
englishText: from when indeed the son of Atreus, lord of men, and godlike Achilles first fell apart, striving
label: Iliad clause 6

greekText: Τίς τάρ σφωε θεῶν ἔριδι ξυνέηκε μάχεσθαι;
englishText: Who of the gods, therefore, set them to fight with each other?
label: Iliad clause 7

englishText: The son of Leto and Zeus [did]
label: Iliad clause 8

greekText: ὃ γὰρ βασιλῆϊ χολωθεὶς νοῦσον ἀνὰ στρατὸν ὄρσε κακήν
englishText: For he, angry at the king, set an evil plague upon the army
label: Iliad clause 9
